New Records: Adames’ home run was his 13th three-run homer of the season, which ties the major-league record set by Ken Griffey Jr. in 1996.
Key Match Events: Pedro Pages had the first two-homer game of his career.
Willy Adames hit a three-run homer in the first inning.
Rhys Hoskins hit a two-run homer in the fourth inning.
Jackson Chourio hit a grand slam in the sixth inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Paul Goldschmidt extended his streak with at least one double to five consecutive games, the longest by a Cardinal since Matt Carpenter doubled in six games in a row in 2017.
The Cardinals fell to 3-8 against the Brewers, including a 1-4 record in Milwaukee.
